result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco J Roberto Mayorga was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $100.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penaly of 20 days jail for non-payment.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid along with Count 1.

records.addlTxt: Received July 1, 2016,   State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Francisco J Roberto Mayorga in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed, formal reading waived.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
Court orders the following:  
Count #1:  FINE:  $1009.00 
Count #2:  FINE:  $1009.00
To be paid at a rate of $100.00 a month commencing 8/1/2016, failure to pay will result in 20 days jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Francisco J Roberto Mayorga in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
